title: Bringing back the 'unskilled player' report
body: I know this never did anything, but sometimes after a game all you want to do is report someone even though they don't fall under any other categories, you just need to vent basically and feel as if you're  doing something against the person who negatively impacted your game by just being generally bad at the game/ their role, its cathartic and I miss it, and would like it returned! Thanks for reading

replies.body: I'll admit it did give some satisfaction to help vent, but it was also detrimental to progressing as a player. Clicking that report button might not do much but it reinforces the idea that "I didn't do anything wrong, it's their fault we lost" which is the wrong attitude. Rather than blame someone we need to think "how could I have changed the outcome? what could I have done different/better to not end up in that situation?".

This is not a good reason to report a player... Just because he/she isn't coming up to your expectations that doesn't mean he should be reported. He might be new to the game who unfortunately got matched with higher experience players.. Now, Faker won't report you if you're in his team and keep dying will he?

people are learning here and you must give them their time to be better!

The unskilled player report didn't have anything to do with the punishment system (which is why it was removed, it was too ambiguous), it only served as a marker for matchmaking (a pretty ineffective one mind you, it really didn't do much at all in the end). Basically if a person was being reported a lot for unskilled player matchmaking needed to get it's shit together.

In the end it was a wholly useless report. I think maybe there are better ways to vent or cool off, but I can see where OP is coming from.

My only suggestion is to remember it's not about winning or even necessarily doing well (though those things are important to have at least sometimes too :) ) but it's about having fun. Cheesy and over said I know but that's the short of it.

dude its a report that if you are not able to keep up with your team it would place you with people that are around your skill lvl, it had no repercussions like getting banned or chat restricted, or even lower que priority. its was simply there to help everyone. so you'd get to go up against people who you can actually play against instead of being matched with people who just mop the floor with you.

Wouldn't you rather play against people of your own skill level? By clicking this button, supposedly it would be taken into consideration and you would be matched with people more of your own skill, making better games for all and helping you to improve.
